task_summary: Detect the drawer handle, approach and grasp it, then open the drawer and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator with a parallel gripper interacts with a wooden cabinet. The goal is to open a closed drawer. The robot must first visually locate the drawer handle, move to a safe pre-grasp pose, align, grasp the handle, and pull to open. The sequence emphasizes reliable perception, tight alignment (±1 cm), and a modest gripper force to avoid slipping. After opening, the robot retreats to clear the drawer front while maintaining scene safety around the countertop and adjacent appliances.
preconditions: Handle is visible or discoverable from the starting view
Workspace is free of obstacles along pull direction
stepwise_plan: If the drawer is already open, skip opening; otherwise continue.
Open gripper and move to a pre-grasp pose.
Align precisely to the handle and close gripper.
Execute the open action on the drawer.
Retreat to clear the drawer front.
success_criteria: No collisions with cabinet or countertop
Gripper releases or maintains safe hold after motion
End pose is clear of the drawer face
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected → re-perceive or adjust viewpoint.
Slip during pull → increase force within limits and reattempt.
Mechanical stop reached early → stop and report.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the drawer is confirmed open or after configured retries/timeouts.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool is well aligned at the handle; contact appears established.
frame_3.predicts_next: Pull actuation to open the drawer is imminent.

frame_5.now_evidence: Drawer translation outward is visible, confirming opening motion.

node_specs.description: Locate the drawer handle in the scene.
Check if the drawer is already open.
Prepare for grasp on the handle.
Move to a safe pre-grasp pose near the handle.
Align gripper to the handle within tight tolerance.
Back away to clear the opened drawer front.

recovery_strategy: Increase grasp force within limits and reattempt
Abort and report if force threshold exceeded
assumptions: Frames indicate a closed drawer that becomes partially open during the sequence.
We abstract the pull with OpenContainer(target='drawer', container_type='drawer').
Exact pull direction is inferred from context; not explicitly parameterized in the library.

expected_success_criteria: No collision with cabinet or countertop
Robot ends in a safe retreat pose
